title: [QUESTION] Why does SKFontStyleWidth not work correctly with some fonts?
body:
I am using SkiaSharp 2.80.2 on Windows 10 with a .NET Core project.

I am running into a weird issue where it appears that `SKFontStyleWidth` does not change a font's width at all once it's written out on a canvas. I am attempting to write using the Century Gothic font, and I noticed this issue when I used `SKTypeface.FromFamilyName` to create a `SKTypeface` using `SKFontStyleWidth.UltraCondensed` first, then `SKFontStyleWidth.UltraExpanded` after, and both times, the `FontWidth` property is set to 5 (which if that maps to the `SKFontStyleWidth` enum, would be `Normal`, instead of what I specified):

```
fontFamily = SKTypeface.FromFamilyName("Century Gothic", SKFontStyleWeight.Bold, SKFontStyleWidth.UltraCondensed, SKFontStyleSlant.Italic);
{SkiaSharp.SKTypeface}
    FamilyName: "Century Gothic"
    FontSlant: Italic
    FontStyle: {SkiaSharp.SKFontStyle}
    FontWeight: 700
    FontWidth: 5
    GlyphCount: 666
    Handle: 0x000002b080612d50
    IgnorePublicDispose: true
    IsBold: true
    IsDisposed: false
    IsFixedPitch: false
    IsItalic: true
    OwnsHandle: true
    Style: BoldItalic
    TableCount: 18
    UnitsPerEm: 2048
fontFamily = SKTypeface.FromFamilyName("Century Gothic", SKFontStyleWeight.Bold, SKFontStyleWidth.UltraExpanded, SKFontStyleSlant.Italic);
{SkiaSharp.SKTypeface}
    FamilyName: "Century Gothic"
    FontSlant: Italic
    FontStyle: {SkiaSharp.SKFontStyle}
    FontWeight: 700
    FontWidth: 5
    GlyphCount: 666
    Handle: 0x000002b080612d50
    IgnorePublicDispose: true
    IsBold: true
    IsDisposed: false
    IsFixedPitch: false
    IsItalic: true
    OwnsHandle: true
    Style: BoldItalic
    TableCount: 18
    UnitsPerEm: 2048
```

I also tried using the Arial font. In that font's case, `SKFontStyleWidth.UltraCondensed` resulted in a `FontWidth` of 3, while `SKFontStyleWidth.UltraExpanded` resulted in 5. I would have expected a much wider variance between 3 and 5.

Can someone help me understand what's going on here, or if I'm doing something wrong in my attempt to change letter spacing for a font?
